content.en:
# Edit Text Manually

Not every text needs to be written by AI - sometimes you want to write yourself or edit AI-generated text. CeleroPress provides you with a powerful rich text editor with all important functions.

## The CeleroPress Editor

The editor is based on modern web standards and offers:

- **Rich Text Formatting**: Bold, italic, underline, strikethrough
- **Headings**: H1, H2, H3 for structured texts
- **Lists**: Bullet points and numbered lists
- **Links**: Insert and edit URLs
- **Quotes**: Blockquotes for quotations
- **Alignment**: Align text left, center, or right
- **Undo/Redo**: Ctrl+Z / Ctrl+Y

[Screenshot: Editor toolbar]

## Basic Text Editing

### Enter Text

1. Click in the editor field
2. Start typing
3. Text is automatically saved (after 1 second pause)

**Auto-Save:**
- Every change is automatically saved
- You see "Saved" top right with green checkmark
- No manual saving necessary

### Format Text

**Make Bold:**
- Select text
- Click **B** in toolbar
- Or: Ctrl/Cmd + B

**Make Italic:**
- Select text
- Click **I** in toolbar
- Or: Ctrl/Cmd + I

**Underline:**
- Select text
- Click **U** in toolbar
- Or: Ctrl/Cmd + U

[Screenshot: Formatting options]

## Add Structure

### Use Headings

Headings structure your press release:

**Headline (H1):**
- Use only ONCE (for main title)
- Automatically adopted from title field

**Subheadings (H2):**
- For main sections
- Example: "The Innovation", "Availability", "Background"

**Sub-subheadings (H3):**
- For subsections
- Use sparingly

**How to apply headings:**
1. Select the line
2. Choose "Heading 2" or "Heading 3" in toolbar

### Create Lists

**Bullet List:**
1. Click on list icon (‚Ä¢)
2. Type first point
3. Press Enter for next point
4. Press Enter twice to end list

**Numbered List:**
1. Click on numbered list icon (1. 2. 3.)
2. Same procedure as bullet points

**Nested Lists:**
- Press Tab to indent a point
- Press Shift+Tab to outdent

[Screenshot: Lists in editor]

## Insert Links

1. Select text to be linked
2. Click on link icon (üîó)
3. Enter URL (e.g., https://example.com)
4. Click "Insert"

**Edit Link:**
- Click on link
- Choose "Edit link" or "Remove link"

**Best Practice:**
- Use descriptive link texts ("To product page" instead of "Click here")
- Check links before sending

## Add Quotes

Quotes make press releases more lively and provide statements:

1. Write or select quote
2. Click on quote icon (")
3. Text is formatted as blockquote

**Example:**
> "This innovation will revolutionize the industry", says CEO John Doe.

**Tip:** Quotes should:
- Be short and concise (1-3 sentences)
- Provide added value (not repeat what's in text)
- Come from relevant people (CEO, expert)

## Align Text

**Left-aligned (Standard):**
- Most press releases are left-aligned
- Best readability

**Centered:**
- For special elements (e.g., quotes)
- Use sparingly

**Right-aligned:**
- Rare in press releases

## Undo / Redo

**Undo last change:**
- Click on ‚Ü∂ (arrow back)
- Or: Ctrl/Cmd + Z

**Redo:**
- Click on ‚Ü∑ (arrow forward)
- Or: Ctrl/Cmd + Y (Windows) / Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + Z (Mac)

**Tip:** Editor saves last 50 actions - you can go back far!

## Best Practices for Press Releases

### Structure of a Good Press Release

**1. Headline**
- Maximum 70 characters
- Contains main news
- Actively formulated

**2. Lead Paragraph**
- First 2-3 sentences
- Answers: Who? What? When? Where?
- Summarizes most important info

**3. Main Body**
- Details about news
- Background
- Facts and figures

**4. Quote**
- From CEO or responsible person
- Gives personal touch
- Adds value to news

**5. Additional Information**
- Supplementary details
- Availability, prices
- Technical specs

**6. Boilerplate** (added separately)
- "About the Company"
- Standard text

**7. Press Contact** (added separately)
- Name, phone, email

### Formatting Tips

**Use Bold for:**
- Important statements
- Product names on first mention
- Numbers and facts that should stand out

**DO NOT use Bold for:**
- Entire paragraphs
- Too many words (loses effect)

**Use Italic for:**
- Technical terms
- Foreign words
- Quote introductions

**Use Lists when:**
- 3+ points are listed
- Features are described
- Benefits are named

### Length and Readability

**Ideal Length:**
- 300-500 words (approx. 1 page)
- For complex topics max. 800 words

**Paragraphs:**
- Maximum 3-4 sentences per paragraph
- Blank line between paragraphs
- Facilitates reading

**Sentences:**
- Short sentences (10-15 words ideal)
- One thought per sentence
- Active instead of passive formulations

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Can I also copy from Word?

**Yes**, but with limitations:

1. Copy text from Word (Ctrl+C)
2. Paste in editor (Ctrl+V)
3. **Formatting is partially adopted**:
   - ‚úÖ Bold, Italic, Underline
   - ‚úÖ Headings (are converted)
   - ‚úÖ Lists
   - ‚ùå Colors (are removed)
   - ‚ùå Fonts (are standardized)
   - ‚ùå Images (must be uploaded separately)

**Tip:** For best results:
- Copy only plain text
- Reformat in CeleroPress editor

### How can I insert images?

**Images do NOT belong in the text editor!**

Use instead:
- **Key Visual**: For main image (below text editor)
- **Media Attachments**: For additional images ("Attachments" tab)

This keeps images and text cleanly separated.

### Can I insert HTML code?

**No**, editor is intentionally limited to safe rich text.

**Why?**
- Prevents errors in PDF
- Guarantees consistent formatting
- Safe against XSS attacks

All important formatting is possible via toolbar.

### Are changes really saved automatically?

**Yes!** Auto-save works like this:

1. You type in editor
2. After 1 second pause, system saves
3. "Saved" appears top right with ‚úì

**If it doesn't work:**
- Check internet connection
- Reload page (data remains)
- For persistent problems: Press Ctrl+S manually

### How many characters/words does my text have?

**Use word counter:**

1. Select entire text (Ctrl+A)
2. Bottom right in editor you see:
   - Number of characters
   - Number of words
   - Estimated reading time

**Or:**
Keyword analysis also shows word count.

## Keyboard Shortcuts

**Formatting:**
- Ctrl/Cmd + B: Bold
- Ctrl/Cmd + I: Italic
- Ctrl/Cmd + U: Underline
- Ctrl/Cmd + K: Insert link

**Editing:**
- Ctrl/Cmd + Z: Undo
- Ctrl/Cmd + Y: Redo (Windows)
- Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + Z: Redo (Mac)

**Navigation:**
- Ctrl/Cmd + A: Select all
- Ctrl/Cmd + C: Copy
- Ctrl/Cmd + V: Paste
- Ctrl/Cmd + X: Cut

**Lists:**
- Tab: Indent
- Shift + Tab: Outdent
- Enter + Enter: End list

**Save:**
- Ctrl/Cmd + S: Manual save (optional)

## Avoid Common Mistakes

### Mistake 1: Too Much Formatting

‚ùå **Wrong:** Everything bold, many colors, different fonts
‚úÖ **Right:** Format sparingly, focus on readability

**Rule of thumb:** Maximum 10% of text should be bold.

### Mistake 2: No Structure

‚ùå **Wrong:** One long flowing text without paragraphs
‚úÖ **Right:** Short paragraphs, subheadings, lists

**Best Practice:** New paragraph every 3-4 sentences.

### Mistake 3: Sentences Too Long

‚ùå **Wrong:** Sentences with 30+ words and many subclauses
‚úÖ **Right:** Short, concise sentences (10-15 words)

**Tip:** Read text aloud - where you need to breathe should be a period.

### Mistake 4: Passive Formulations

‚ùå **Wrong:** "The product was developed"
‚úÖ **Right:** "We developed the product"

**Why:** Active language is more direct and lively.

### Mistake 5: No Quotes

‚ùå **Wrong:** Only flowing text
‚úÖ **Right:** Include at least ONE quote

**Quotes:**
- Provide statements
- Humanize news
- Are journalistically valuable

## Integration with Other Features

### With AI Optimization:

1. Write text manually
2. Select section to be optimized
3. Click "Optimize text"
4. AI improves formulation, style or length

### With Keyword Analysis:

1. Write text
2. Define keywords (below editor)
3. Check keyword density
4. Adjust text if necessary

### With Translations:

1. Write text in German
2. Use translation feature
3. Text is translated while maintaining formatting

## Tips for Faster Work

### Tip 1: Learn Keyboard Shortcuts

The 5 most important:
- Ctrl+B (Bold)
- Ctrl+I (Italic)
- Ctrl+Z (Undo)
- Ctrl+K (Link)
- Ctrl+A (Select all)

### Tip 2: Write First, Format Later

1. Write entire text down
2. THEN format (bold, lists, etc.)

**Why:** Doesn't interrupt writing flow.

### Tip 3: Use Templates

Create templates for recurring press release types:

- Product launch
- Personnel news
- Company news
- Event announcement

### Tip 4: Proofread in Preview

Switch to "Preview" tab:
- See text as in PDF
- Recognize formatting errors better
- Get impression of overall picture

### Tip 5: Use Auto-Save

Rely on automatic saving:
- No constant Ctrl+S necessary
- Can pause anytime
- Changes are immediately secured

## Next Steps

- [Write text with AI assistant](/support/en/text-mit-ki-assistent-schreiben)
- [Optimize text for keywords](/support/en/text-auf-keywords-optimieren)
- [Set keywords](/support/en/keywords-einstellen)
- [Generate key visual](/support/en/key-visual-erzeugen)
- [Select boilerplates](/support/en/textbausteine-auswaehlen)
